name: Cork Islamic Cultural Center (CICC)
desc: Private donation by Ahmed al-Hamadi, presumably member of the General Assembly of Qatar Charity (QC). The local Muslim community is connected to the MB, there are also tight links to the FIOE, the MB’s European umbrella organization.

name: Sheffield mosque and community center
desc: The project is realized by the Emaan Trust, which is closely connected to the Kuwait MB. Funding by QC.

name: University of Oxford, Middle East Center at St Antony’s College
desc: The Qatar Foundation has financed a Professorship for Contemporary Islamic studies. The first professor is the Muslim Brother Tariq Ramadan.

name: University of Oxford, Middle East Center at St Antony’s College
desc: The Qatar Foundation or the state of Qatar have funded a new campus building at the place of Tariq Ramadan’s teaching (via the intermediary Investcorp).

name: Islamic Relief Worldwide
desc: Donations by QC.

name: Human Relief Foundation
desc: Donations by QC.

name: Muslim Aid
desc: Donations by QC.

name: The Humanitarian Forum
desc: Donations by QC.

name: Centro Cultural Islámico Catalán (CCIC), Barcelona
desc: This center is associated with the Liga Islamica para el Dialogo y la Convivencia, which is the Spanish branch of the Syrian MB. Donations by the state of Qatar.

name: Unione delle Comunita Islamishe d'Italia (UCOII)
desc: Regarded to be the Italian branch of the MB. Donations by QC.

name: Hamad bin Khalifa Centre, Copenhagen
desc: Run by the Danish Islamic Council, the Danish wing of the MB. Donation by the Father Emir of Qatar.

name: Malmö mosque and Islamic center
desc: Run by Wakf of Skandinavia in Sweden, which has links to the MB. Donation by the state of Qatar.

name: Blauwe Moskee, Amsterdam
desc: Was realized by the Europe Trust Netherlands (ETU), the Dutch brand of the Europe Trust UK, who is regarded to be the financial intermediary of the MB in Europe. Funding by state of Qatar.

name: Ligue des Musulmans de Belgique (LMB)
desc: LMB has been identified as a part of the Belgian MB structure. LMB is also a member of FIOE, the MB´s European umbrella organization. Funding by QC.

name: Grande Mosquee de Reims
desc:
Run by AMCIR, local UOIF community.
Donation by QC.

name: Mosquee de Hautepierre
desc: Has recently celebrated the inauguration of the first section together with a Qatari delegation. Run by ARSH, associated to UOIF.
year: Fund-raising by QC still in progress

name: Centre An Nour Mulhouse
desc: The biggest Qatari funded French mosque project. Run by AMAL, an UOIF satellite organization.
year: 2012–2017 and fund-raising by QC still in progress.

name: Mosquee Assalam de Nantes
desc: Private Qatari Donor Abdullah Al-Darwish. Run by AOIF, an UOIF satellite organization.

name: Institut Europeen des Sciences Humaines (IESH)
desc: Religious college and imam training center. Funded by FIOE and associated to UOIF.
year: Since 2007 and fundraising by QC still in progress.

name: Lycée-Collège Averroès
desc: Private Islamic secondary School. The school’s founder Amar Lasfar is the current president of the UOIF. Donation by QC.

name: Collège-Lycée Ibn-Khaldoun
desc: Was founded by the UOIF in 2009 and is headed by imam Mohsen N’gazou, a former vice-president of the organization.
